name.text: 27.1.5.6 Special Cases of Double Integrals Exercise

questiontext.text:
Exercise

  1. Evaluate the integral \(I_1= \displaystyle \int_{@aa@}^{@bb@}\displaystyle\int_{@cc@}^{@dd@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}y \mathrm{d}x = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

    If your answer is not an integer, leave it in rational form e.g. 23/5.

  2. Which of the following integrals gives the same value as \(I_1\)? [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

    3. \( (i) \quad \displaystyle \int_{@cc@}^{@dd@}\displaystyle\int_{@aa@}^{@bb@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}y \mathrm{d}x \)

    \( (ii) \quad\displaystyle \int_{@aa@}^{@bb@}\displaystyle\int_{@cc@}^{@dd@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}x \mathrm{d}y \)

    \( (iii)\quad\displaystyle \int_{@cc@}^{@dd@}\displaystyle\int_{@aa@}^{@bb@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}x \mathrm{d}y \)

    \( (iv) \quad\displaystyle - \int_{@cc@}^{@dd@}\displaystyle\int_{@aa@}^{@bb@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}y \mathrm{d}x \)

    \( (v) \quad\displaystyle - \int_{@aa@}^{@bb@}\displaystyle\int_{@cc@}^{@dd@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}x \mathrm{d}y \)

generalfeedback.text:
(a) We are asked to evaluate the integral \(I_1 = \displaystyle \int_{@aa@}^{@bb@}\displaystyle\int_{@cc@}^{@dd@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}y \mathrm{d}x, \)

The area of integration for which is shown below.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [{#xmin#}, {#ymax#}, {#xmax#}, {#ymin#}], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on x-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.x.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, // hide numbers majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'x', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [1, -10] } }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on y-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.y.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'y', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [-15, 0] } }); // Create points and rectangle var bl = board.create('point', [{#aa#},{#cc#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var br = board.create('point', [{#bb#},{#cc#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}) var tr = board.create('point', [{#bb#},{#dd#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var tl = board.create('point', [{#aa#},{#dd#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var rectangle = board.create('polygon', [bl, br, tr, tl],{name:"Rectangle",withLabel:false, color: 'white'}); // Set all edges (borders) to black rectangle.borders.forEach(line => { line.setAttribute({strokeColor: 'darkblue'}); }); // Label coordinates dynamically [bl, br, tr, tl].forEach((pt) => { board.create('text', [ () => pt.X() + 0.1, () => pt.Y() + 0.1, () => `(${pt.X()}, ${pt.Y()})` ], { fontSize: 12, fixed: true, highlight: false }); }); [[/jsxgraph]]

We first evaluate the inner integral.

\(\begin{align} \text{Inner Integral} &=\displaystyle \int_{@cc@}^{@dd@} x^3y \, \mathrm{d}y \\ &= \left[ \dfrac{x^3y^2}{2}\right]_{@cc@}^{@dd@} \\ &= \dfrac{{@dd@}^2 x^3}{2} - \dfrac{({@cc@})^2 x^3}{2} \\ &= {@ee@}x^3. \end{align} \)

Substituting this into the outer integral, we get

\(\begin{align} I_1 &= \displaystyle \int_{@aa@}^{@bb@} {@ee@}x^3 \, \mathrm{d}x \\ &= \left[{@ee/4@}x^4\right]_{@aa@}^{@bb@} \\ &= {@ee/4@}({@bb@})^4 - \left( {@ee/4@}({@aa@})^4\right) \\ &= {@ee/4*(bb)^4 - ee/4*(aa)^4@}. \end{align} \)


(b) The correct answer is \((iii)\). Since this is an integration over a rectangular area, we can change the order of integration and we will get the same answer. This is done by swapping the order of both the limits and the corresponding \(\mathrm{d}x\) and \(\mathrm{d}y\) terms.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
